definition: lit. the trees long for peace but the wind will never cease (idiom)/fig. the world changes, whether you want it or not
pinyin: shu4 yu4 jing4 er2 feng1 bu4 zhi3

definition: tree/CL:棵[ke1]/to cultivate/to set up
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
still/calm/quiet/not moving
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
(negative prefix)/not/no
to stop/to prohibit/until/only

sentences.english: The son desires to serve, but his parents are no more.
sentences.chinese: 樹欲靜而風不止，子欲養而親不在。

sentences.english: Old saying "Tree prefer calm while wind not subside; Son choose filial while parents died."
sentences.chinese: 古人說“樹欲靜而風不止，子欲養而親不待”。

sentences.english: However, the tree prefers calm but the wind keeps blowing.
sentences.chinese: 可是，“樹欲靜而風不止，子欲養而親不待”。

definition: to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
compassion/empathetic
apprehension/apprehensive
muddle-headed
to be reluctant to give up a post
(Buddhism) predestined relationship
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
skin-deep/superficial/shallow
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
